home.title: Rab Ráby Restaurant, Szentendre
home.description: We warmly welcome you to our restaurant in the heart of Szentendre. Delicious food, antiques, breathtaking interior, and favorable prices since 1982.

faq.q: From how many people is it considered a group?
How many different menus can I order?
faq.a: We can prepare menus for more than 15 people.

faq.q: What is the capacity of the restaurant?
faq.a: A maximum of 90-100 people indoors and 25-30 people in the garden.

faq.q: How can I make a reservation?
faq.a: The simplest way is to write us an email detailing the specifics

faq.q: Why are the prices listed in euros?
faq.a: Due to hyperinflation in recent years, prices are listed in euros to maintain consistency throughout the year.

faq.q: Is there a bus parking nearby?
faq.a: Yes, there is a large parking lot next to the main road 11, about a 7-minute walk from us.

faq.q: How far in advance should I book?
faq.a: It's advisable to book several weeks in advance to ensure availability.

faq.q: What should I do if there is a guest with a food allergy?
faq.a: It's important to inform us so that guests with food allergies can receive alternative dishes instead of the group menus.

people.name: Katalin Novák
people.title: President of Hungary (2022-2024)
people.text: Thank you for allowing us to rest here for a short time on a tiring workday and taste genuine homemade flavors.

people.name: Levente Balogh
people.title: Water King, Businessman, Investor
people.text: Thank you for the cozy hospitality!

people.name: András Moldován
people.title: Pork Mogul, Investor, Shark
people.text: We had a great dinner here with pleasure!

people.name: Mária Varga
people.text: Entering feels like stepping into an archival museum yet a very homely feeling arises. The staff is quick, attentive, and the food is excellent. We had a great time and recommend it to everyone!

people.name: Gábor Molnár
people.text: Rab Ráby Restaurant is a true gem! The menu offers a wide selection, and the dishes are always fresh and of excellent quality. I always find something delicious on the menu, and the desserts are divine too!

people.name: Éva Kovács
people.text: It was once again an experience. The food is great, the service is good, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is magical. It's a bit nostalgic for me to come here because it was where my husband and I had our first date.

questions.question: Can I pay with card?
questions.answer: Yes, you can pay with a credit card. (We cannot accept American Express cards)

questions.question: Where can I park?
questions.answer: Parking in Szentendre changed in 2022: the old town can only be accessed with a permit. The nearest parking lot to us is about 1 minute walk away, on Bajcsy-Zsilinszky Endre Street. (Zone code: 2012)

questions.question: Where can I find the restaurant?
questions.answer: The restaurant is located in the downtown area of Szentendre, between the Town Hall and the Péter Pál Church. It is reachable within 1 minute walk from the city center.

questions.question: Do you have a garden terrace, patio?
questions.answer: Yes, the restaurant has a cozy, wind-protected inner courtyard, which is cool and shady in summer.

questions.question: Can I bring my dog?
questions.answer: Yes, we have been a dog-friendly place since our opening.

questions.question: Is there WiFi?
questions.answer: Yes, without password. WiFi name: RAB_RÁBY_WIFI

questions.question: Do you also host events?
questions.answer: Yes, we host weddings, baptisms, birthdays, name days, class reunions, book presentations, wine tastings, funeral receptions, etc.

food.title: Menu
food.price: Prices are for informational purposes only! Errors may occur, and the prices listed on our printed menu are official!

about.text: The restaurant was founded by János Németh and his family in 1982, during the time of the Iron Curtain. It was named after the hero of Mór Jókai's novel, Rab Ráby, who lived in Szentendre and played a key role in fighting corruption during the reign of Joseph II. The building, which was converted into the restaurant, functioned as a blacksmith's workshop over 100 years ago. In addition to an ethnographic exhibition, the restaurant also features rare curiosities.
